fr.sii.ogham.email.message.fluent

Class EmbedBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.email.message.fluent.EmbedBuilder

  • public class EmbedBuilder
extends Object
    Fluent API to embed a file to the email (mainly used for images). The file must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Method Detail

      • file

        public Email file(String contentId,
                  File file)
        Embed a file to the email. The file must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is automatically determined.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        file - the file to attach
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining

      • file

        public Email file(String contentId,
                  File file,
                  String contentType)
        Embed a file to the email. The file must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is explicitly set.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        file - the file to attach
        contentType - the Content-Type of the attachment
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining

                  Path path)
        Embed a file to the email. The file must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is automatically determined.

        Parameters:

        path - the path to the file to attach
        Returns:

      • file

        public Email file(String contentId,
                  Path path,
                  String contentType)
        Embed a file to the email. The file must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is explicitly set.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        path - the path to the file to attach
        contentType - the Content-Type of the attachment
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining

      • resource

        public Email resource(String contentId,
                      String path)
        Embed a resource loaded from a path to the email. The resource must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The path may contain the lookup prefix (a prefix that indicates where to find the resource). For example:

        • "classpath:/path/to/file.pdf" references a resource that is located at "path/to/file.pdf" in the classpath (from the root)
        • "file:/path/to/file.pdf" references a resource that is located at "/path/to/file.pdf" in the file system
        By default, if the path doesn't contain any lookup prefix then the resource is loaded from the root of the classpath.

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is automatically determined.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        path - the path to the resource to attach
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining

      • resource

        public Email resource(String contentId,
                      String path,
                      String contentType)
        Embed a resource loaded from a path to the email. The resource must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The path may contain the lookup prefix (a prefix that indicates where to find the resource). For example:

        • "classpath:/path/to/file.pdf" references a resource that is located at "path/to/file.pdf" in the classpath (from the root)
        • "file:/path/to/file.pdf" references a resource that is located at "/path/to/file.pdf" in the file system
        By default, if the path doesn't contain any lookup prefix then the resource is loaded from the root of the classpath.

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is explicitly set.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        path - the path to the resource to attach
        contentType - the Content-Type of the attachment
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining

      • resource

        public Email resource(String contentId,
                      ResourcePath path)
        Embed a resource loaded from a path to the email. The resource must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The path may contain the lookup prefix (a prefix that indicates where to find the resource). For example:

        • "classpath:/path/to/file.pdf" references a resource that is located at "path/to/file.pdf" in the classpath (from the root)
        • "file:/path/to/file.pdf" references a resource that is located at "/path/to/file.pdf" in the file system
        By default, if the path doesn't contain any lookup prefix then the resource is loaded from the root of the classpath.

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is automatically determined.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        path - the path to the resource to attach
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining

      • resource

        public Email resource(String contentId,
                      ResourcePath path,
                      String contentType)
        Embed a resource loaded from a path to the email. The resource must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The path may contain the lookup prefix (a prefix that indicates where to find the resource). For example:

        • "classpath:/path/to/file.pdf" references a resource that is located at "path/to/file.pdf" in the classpath (from the root)
        • "file:/path/to/file.pdf" references a resource that is located at "/path/to/file.pdf" in the file system
        By default, if the path doesn't contain any lookup prefix then the resource is loaded from the root of the classpath.

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is explicitly set.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        path - the path to the resource to attach
        contentType - the Content-Type of the attachment
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining

      • bytes

        public Email bytes(String contentId,
                   byte[] bytes)
        Embed a resource to the email directly using the bytes. The embedded resource must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is automatically determined.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        bytes - the content of the attachment
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining

      • bytes

        public Email bytes(String contentId,
                   byte[] bytes,
                   String contentType)
        Embed a resource to the email directly using the bytes. The embedded resource must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is explicitly set.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        bytes - the content of the attachment
        contentType - the Content-Type of the attachment
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining

      • stream

        public Email stream(String contentId,
                    InputStream stream)
             throws IOException
        Attach a resource to the email directly using the bytes read from the InputStream. The InputStream is immediately read and converted to a byte array. The embedded resource must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        IMPORTANT: You need to manually close the stream.

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is automatically determined.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        stream - the content of the attachment
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining
        Throws:
        IOException - when the InputStream can't be read

      • stream

        public Email stream(String contentId,
                    InputStream stream,
                    String contentType)
             throws IOException
        Attach a resource to the email directly using the bytes read from the InputStream. The InputStream is immediately read and converted to a byte array. The embedded resource must be referenced in the email body using a Content-ID (or CID).

        IMPORTANT: You need to manually close the stream.

        The disposition of the attachment is set to ContentDisposition.INLINE.

        The Content-Type of the attachment is explicitly set.

        Parameters:
        contentId - the Content-ID used to reference the embedded attachment in the email body
        stream - the content of the attachment
        contentType - the Content-Type of the attachment
        Returns:
        the email instance for fluent chaining
        Throws:
        IOException - when the InputStream can't be read
